page.title: 04POPULATION/EMPLOYMENT.WILDEN
page.content: THE BLOCK POPULATION IS ABOUT 500. The age structure seems reasonably well-balanced. Wilden is far from being a dormitory village for long-distance commuters. About a third of the working population is employed in the area, and on the land, about half work in Bedford, and the rest commute greater distances e.g. London. In {housing,} there is an even distribution of old, new, private and rented. There is a rich diversity of styles, some of historical interest. The occupation pattern shows a surprising balance between long-term residents and newcomers. Also of interest is the fact that many long-term residents live in relatively new houses, while the newcomers occupy the more historic houses.New housing development supports housing for the elderly.
